unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Uptick in Data Plan Adoption**
normalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Uptick in Data Plan Adoption**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26th – Indian telecom providers are reporting a surge in data plan subscriptions, driven by increased smartphone penetration and the growing popularity of OTT platforms. Reliance Jio and Airtel are leading the charge with competitive offerings.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty sixth – Indian telecom providers are reporting a surge in data plan subscriptions, driven by increased smartphone penetration and the growing popularity of O T T platforms. Reliance Jio and Airtel are leading the charge with competitive offerings.

unnormalised: Industry analysts at IIT Bombay note a 15% increase in average data consumption per user in Q3 2023, largely fuelled by video streaming and online gaming. This trend is reminiscent of the explosive growth witnessed post the release of the film "3 Idiots" which showcased the power of technology.
normalised: Industry analysts at I I T Bombay note a fifteen percent increase in average data consumption per user in Q three two thousand twenty three, largely fuelled by video streaming and online gaming. This trend is reminiscent of the explosive growth witnessed post the release of the film "Three Idiots" which showcased the power of technology.

unnormalised: "Consumers are demanding more value for money," said Mr. Sharma, a telecom expert. "Bundled plans offering unlimited calling and increased data allowances are particularly attractive."
normalised: "Consumers are demanding more value for money," said Mister Sharma, a telecom expert. "Bundled plans offering unlimited calling and increased data allowances are particularly attractive."

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel recently launched a new Rs. 499 data plan, while Vodafone Idea unveiled a regional offer in Uttar Pradesh providing 50 GB of data for 28 days. The competition continues to benefit the end-user, with more data at increasingly affordable rates.
normalised: Bharti Airtel recently launched a new rupee four hundred and ninety nine data plan, while Vodafone Idea unveiled a regional offer in Uttar Pradesh providing fifty G B of data for twenty eight days. The competition continues to benefit the end-user, with more data at increasingly affordable rates.
